meanings.definition: A sudden frenzied rush of a number of horses, cattle, or other animals.
meanings.sent1: During the stampede, the horses ran wildly in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The stampede of cattle caused chaos on the farm.
meanings.sent3: The stampede of animals to the water trough was quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: The stampede of horses resembled a river flowing through the field.
meanings.sent5: The stampede of cows thundered across the open field.

meanings.definition: A sudden mass movement of people in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The stampede of shoppers towards the sale rack was intense.
meanings.sent2: The stampede of fans towards the stage created a commotion.
meanings.sent3: The stampede of students to the cafeteria for lunch was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The stampede of tourists towards the famous landmark was like a wave crashing on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The stampede of protesters flooded the streets with their chants.
